data.title: Remove contrails from AA Gun and Sniper.
data.body: Fixes #5417.

data.title: Remove contrails from AA and snipers
data.body: This was a nice idea, but the current contrail rendering makes them look like a rendering glitch.  We should remove these to avoid spurious bug reports.

data.title: Expose Tech Level to End User via GUI

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
WolfGaming did some work allowing tech levels as a feature:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5280
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4956
Now I would like to see these tech levels exposed to the end user via the GUI.
- [x] Tiberian Dawn https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5833
- [x] Red Alert #5901
- [x] Dune 2000 https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5898
- [x] Tiberian Sun #12984
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2317974-expose-tech-level-to-end-user-via-gui?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix #5414
data.body:
This will probably fix it.

We need a proper shutdown sequence, leaving the map/world should start the dispose chain.

data.title: Replay writing crash
data.body:
Regression from #5215.

```
Exception of type `System.ObjectDisposedException`: The object was used after being disposed.
```

data.title: Reduce Grenadier dmg vs. heavy from 50% -> 35%
data.body:
Grenadier is a wee bit too powerful vs. heavy. 
After this change, grenadier will still keep its value vs. heavy armor still very high, but not OP like it is for the cost. 
(Grenadier will still have highest DPS vs. heavy as a function of cost, after this nerf).

data.title: Formatting
data.body: Some formatting fixes: spaces to tabs, indents, etc.

data.title: General Cleanup
data.body:
General cleanup of hopefully uncontroversial things:
- Made private methods static where possible (runtime can elide checking the object for null).
- Declared attribute classes as sealed (allows reflection on attributes to complete faster).
- Moved some static cctor's into field initializers (static cctor's are slower than static field initializers).
- Made classes static if they contained only static methods (can't create instances of useless objects).
- Use inferable Exts.Lazy and not new Lazy<T>().
- Added required STAThread attribute to CrashDialog.
- Removed unused parameters in private methods.
- Added Serializable attribute to exceptions.
- Added parameter name in calls to ArgumentNullException.
- Use of as operator instead of is + cast.
- Changed (x as Foo).Bar anti-pattern into ((Foo)x).Bar. Results in sensible cast exceptions on error rather than null dereferences.
- Removed unused method in NullShader.

data.title: Disposable fixup
data.body:
- Implement IDisposable interface correctly, with sealed classes where possible for simplicity.
- Add using statement around undisposed local variables.

data.title: Name releases using unit or building names
data.body: A suggestion, give a unique name to each release, chosen from the units or buildings from the CnC universe.

data.title: Changed logging in DoTimed/RunActivity to create less overhead
data.body: Added a specific method for calling the PerfTimer with the long tick threshold as the limit, and outputting in the tick format. This is carefully designed to delay creating the output string until it is needed and avoid allocations. The class itself has been refactored slightly to reduce its memory footprint since so many are created.

data.title: Maps: 1 new map, 2 map updates
data.body:
1 new map: "Profit Over People" (1vs1)
1 fix: "Hegemony or Survival" was changed to the 4P version, since 8P doesn't get much play, but the 4P is actually fun and 2vs2 happens.
Re-added the 8P-version with "8P" suffix, if ever people still want to play a 4vs4.

data.title: Changed HardwarePalette.ApplyModifiers to be more efficient.
data.body:
It will no longer copy the dictionaries or palettes every time, saving significantly on allocations.
Non modifiable palettes are copied to the buffer when they are added, rather than having to be done repeatedly in ApplyModifiers.
The palettesModified flag tracks if the current texture represents unmodified palettes. If it does and no modifications are made then it doesn't have to update the texture at all and can bail early. This is often the case because the paletteMods sequence is usually empty.

data.title: Added MinBy, MaxBy, etc.
data.body: Added MinBy, MaxBy, MinByOrDefault and MaxByOrDefault methods and replaced calls of the style OrderBy{Descending}().First{OrDefault}() which is not as performant.

data.title: Changed removeActorPosition field in ActorMap into a set.
data.body: This is because it's purpose is to be queried via Contains when actors needed to be removed.

data.title: Unify settings for solution and project setups.
data.body:
Create a single solution platform named x86.
Ensure both Debug and Release configs build to the root for all projects.
Ensure all Release configs generate pdbs.

data.title: Fixed TraitDictionary.Contains to use Any() rather than Count() != 0.
data.body: This means it can bail early if a match is found.

data.title: Changed MiniYaml.NodesDict property into a method.
data.body: Cached a few invocations into locals which should prevent some redundant evaluation.

data.title: Implemented IEquatable<T>
data.body:
Actor, CPos, CVec, WAngle, WPos, WRange, WRot and WVec structs now implement IEquatable<T> which means unboxing/casting costs can be eliminated.

Also simplified the ToString method by concatenating components directly rather than using a format string since the overhead is a bit high for simple cases like this.

data.title: Fixes #5394 Spawnpoint dropdown count
data.body: Not a big change, just uses the correct variable for counting the number of spawn points to display in the chooser.

data.title: Profiling guided tweaks
data.body:
I decided to run the code through the CPU profiling, memory profiling and static analysis assault course and fix whatever low hanging fruit I could find.

Lots of small but hopefully simple changes. Generally things along the lines of:
- Tweaking some methods that showed up a lot in CPU profiling to make them faster.
- Tweaking methods that showed up in memory profiling to produce less garbage (typically by replacing a LINQ query with a loop so delegates don't need to be allocated).
- Following some static analysis advice, marking attributes sealed, marking some methods as static, removing unused parameters, etc.
- Changing some IDisposable stuff to follow the standard pattern where possible.
- Added some missing using statements around resources that were otherwise having to be finalized.
- Fix the solution/project files so they are consistent.

No major redesigns or anything, just tweaking what's already there (I'm aware you're in a feature freeze - I wouldn't worry about this PR too much for now since I didn't set out to fix any specific bugs or anything).

I'm hoping I've done a half decent job at following the guidelines but do point out anything that's out of place so I can be aware of it in future.

data.title: Screenshots
data.body:
Takes screenshots (see #5317). The default key is Ctrl+P because PrintScreen is intercepted higher up and not processed by the game.

The screenshot file format is JPEG by default but can be changed to PNG or BMP in settings.yaml.

data.title: TS mod fixes and additions
data.body:
Lots of smaller things, a few larger ones.

Note: I'm aware that some offsets need more fine-tuning, I also had some problems with setting up correct offsets for the deployed tick tank and artillery turrets & barrels. I'll leave that for later.

data.title: Make user file locations configurable
data.body:
This allows the user to change the location of the game files
that typically go under `Platform.SupportDir`.

While one can change the whole `Platform.SupportDir` location,
its primary purpose it to be able to change the location of
runtime generated files, like logs, replays, screenshots (TODO).

data.title: Spawnpoint lobby dropdown doesn't respect the number of spawnpoints
data.body: Instead it's based on the number of players, and will populate the dropdown accordingly. This is a big problem for scripted maps which don't necessarily have selectable spawn points.

data.title: Support per-animation palettes in RenderSprites.
data.body: Cleans up one of the remaining tasks from #3348, and fixes the crane, starport, and repair depot animations in D2K.

data.title: Adds separate LevelUpPalette to GainsExperience
data.body:
Needed for TS mod, as TS' own veteran crate effect anim uses a different palette than the rank chevrons. Would allow us to remove the RA backfall.
As this is a very small & simple change and didn't show any regressions in the shipping mods during testing, I hope this won't fall under the feature freeze.

Prerequisite for a larger TS mod update I have in the pipeline.

data.title: Added a configure script for system dependencies
data.body: This is very important for proper downstream Linux packaging. Otherwise you will need to patch this manually which is very annoying. Note: this does not unbundle any native dependencies from packages created on our Ubuntu build server with our own hacky packaging scripts.

data.title: Fixes #4955 aircraft reservation crash
data.body: The unchecked reservation in HeliReturn.cs was the cause of the crash reported in #4955, and I added an additional UnReserve call when attempting to reserve the spawn point.  This may no longer be necessary due to more recent changes in how helicopters spawn, but since we are not attempting to clean up this code until after release I made sure to UnReserve before attempting any Reservation.

data.title: Preload sequences
data.body:
(Depends on #5384)

This forces all sequences to be preloaded on map start. It makes the initial map load longer (roughly 40%) but it prevents the loading freeze in-game.

Note: I initially tried to do it without relying on `OpenWithExts` throwing `FileNotFoundException` but it would require changing too many things or accept `null` values into the `sequences` dictionary, which would be worse long-term. This is why I added `TryOpenWithExts` but don't actually use it.
